Line 397: Line 397:
{{*}}{{flagicon|United Arab Emirates}} in the '''United Arab Emirates''' a group of intellectuals petitioned their ruler for comprehensive reform of the [[Federal National Council]] or parliament, including demands for free elections by all citizens in the method of universal suffrage. About 160 people signed the petition, many of them academics and former members of the FNC.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Thousands stage rally in Bahrain |author=[[Al-Jazeera English]] |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/03/20113917595654981.html |newspaper=|date=9 March 2011 |accessdate=10 March 2011}}</ref> On 12 April, Ahmed Mansoor, a prominent blogger and pro-democracy activist, has been charged with possession of alcohol after being arrested last week. According to his lawyer, two other men, a blogger and a political commentator, were detained a few days earlier, although the police has denied it.<ref>{{cite news |title=Arrested UAE blogger accused of possessing alcohol |author=[[Reuters]] |url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/04/12/us-emirates-activists-idUSTRE73B2EP20110412 |newspaper= |date=12 April 2011 |accessdate=15 April 2011}}</ref>
{{*}}{{flagicon|United Arab Emirates}} in the '''United Arab Emirates''' a group of intellectuals petitioned their ruler for comprehensive reform of the [[Federal National Council]] or parliament, including demands for free elections by all citizens in the method of universal suffrage. About 160 people signed the petition, many of them academics and former members of the FNC.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Thousands stage rally in Bahrain |author=[[Al-Jazeera English]] |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/03/20113917595654981.html |newspaper=|date=9 March 2011 |accessdate=10 March 2011}}</ref> On 12 April, Ahmed Mansoor, a prominent blogger and pro-democracy activist, has been charged with possession of alcohol after being arrested last week. According to his lawyer, two other men, a blogger and a political commentator, were detained a few days earlier, although the police has denied it.<ref>{{cite news |title=Arrested UAE blogger accused of possessing alcohol |author=[[Reuters]] |url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/04/12/us-emirates-activists-idUSTRE73B2EP20110412 |newspaper= |date=12 April 2011 |accessdate=15 April 2011}}</ref>
â  
{{*}}In '''Western Sahara''', a series of minor protests where held by young [[Sahrawis]] to protest against labour discrimination, lack of jobs, looting of resources and human rights abuses.<ref name="Ref-1"/> Although protests through February and March were part of an existing series of [[2010â2011 Sahrawi protests|Sahrawi protests]] originating in October 2010, protesters cited inspiration from the events in other parts of the region. A few academics, such as [[Noam Chomsky]], viewed the October protests as the starting point from which "the current wave of protests actually began".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/programmes/empire/2011/02/20112211027266463.html|title=The genie is out of the bottle|date=21 February 2011[first published on Democracy Now! on 17 February 2011]|author=Noam Chomsky and Marwan Bishara|publisher=Al Jazeera}}</ref>
{{*}}In '''Western Sahara''', a series of minor protests where held by young [[Sahrawis]] to protest against labour discrimination, lack of jobs, looting of resources and human rights abuses.<ref name="Ref-1"/> Although protests through February and March were part of an existing series of [[2010â2011 Sahrawi protests|Sahrawi protests]] originating in October 2010, protesters cited inspiration from the events in other parts of the region. A few academics, such as [[Noam Chomsky]], viewed the October protests as the starting point from which "the current wave of protests actually began".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/programmes/empire/2011/02/20112211027266463.html|title=The genie is out of the bottle|date=21 February 2011[first published on Democracy Now! on 17 February 2011]|author=Noam Chomsky and Marwan Bishara|publisher=Al Jazeera}}</ref>
